benchmark_details.name: DyTAG Benchmarks
benchmark_details.overview: DyTAG Benchmarks are designed to evaluate Dynamic Text-Attribute Graphs (DyTAGs) which involve time-evolving graph interactions and associated text attributes. The benchmarks include various datasets and tasks related to node classification, link prediction, and destination node retrieval.
benchmark_details.data_type: dynamic graph interactions with text attributes

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To study the recent-global spatio-temporal patterns in DyTAGs and evaluate the proposed DyGRASP model's effectiveness on these patterns.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance not validated on diverse real-world datasets beyond DTGB benchmarks.

data.source: Four datasets extracted from various domains including GDELT, Enron, Googlemap, and Stack_elec.
data.size: Differing sizes across datasets, with GDELT having 6,786 nodes and 1,339,245 edges, and others varying accordingly.
data.annotation: Text attributes derived from user reviews, email content, etc.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the proportion of successful interactions within top-k predictions.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Hit@10 percentage indicates better performance in retrieving destination nodes.
methodology.baseline_results: DyGRASP outperformed other methods in Hit@10 metric and future link prediction tasks.
methodology.validation: Models validated using train-test splits with a rigorous evaluation process.
